intro: Calceolus candidus, commonly known as the white helleborine, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Orchidaceae family. It is characterized by its showy, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist woodlands and has a rosette of broad, lance-shaped leaves. Its roots are fibrous and adapted to absorb nutrients from the rich, organic soil in its habitat. Calceolus candidus is known for its delicate appearance and is often found in temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia.
